sense.name: Examine for the presence of something or to test suitability
sense.examples: Officers screen the suitcases at security. Screen the tests for cheating. The lab technician screened the blood for the HIV virus. Patients should be screened for cancer each year. Screen these samples for the project. The company screened the job applicants.

sense.name: Project onto a screen for viewing
sense.examples: The Sundance Film Festival screened several films centered around the same theme.

sense.name: Separate or give protection with or as if with a screen
sense.examples: The blinds screen the strong sunlight. They insist that CFCs are damaging the earth 's stratospheric ozone layer, which screens out some of the sun's ultraviolet rays . She screened the child from harm. The trees screened him from the air raid. Screen off this part of the room. The actors screened off the back half of the stage as a dressing room.

sense.name: Separate with a riddle, as grain from chaff.
